alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 10:08PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northern Dundy Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 1008 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Pleasant Valley, or 18 miles southeast of Holyoke, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
